'''Dragon Player''' is a simple [[media player (application software)|media player]] for the [[KDE]] [[desktop environment]]. It is the renamed continuation of a video player for [[KDE 3]] called Codeine, which was originally created and developed by Max Howell, and is now developed by Ian Monroe under the new name for [[KDE 4]].<ref>[http://dragonplayer.org/ Dragon Player website]</ref> Because Dragon Player makes use of [[Phonon (KDE)|Phonon]]âa multimedia API that itself connects to any of several [[multimedia framework|multimedia frameworks]]âit will play anything the particular connected [[multimedia framework]] supports. It is the default video player in the [[KDE 4]] version of [[Kubuntu]] 8.04.<ref>[http://kubuntu.org/announcements/8.04-release.php Kubuntu 8.04 Released]</ref> Licensed under the [[GNU General Public License|GPL]], Dragon Player is [[free software]].
+
'''Dragon Player''' is a simple [[media player (application software)|media player]] for the [[KDE]] [[desktop environment]]. It is the renamed continuation of a video player for [[KDE 3]] called Codeine, which was originally created and developed by Max Howell, and is now developed by Ian Monroe under the new name for [[KDE 4]].<ref>[http://dragonplayer.org/ Dragon Player website]</ref> Because Dragon Player makes use of [[Phonon (KDE)|Phonon]]âa multimedia API that itself connects to any of several [[multimedia framework|multimedia frameworks]]âit will play anything the particular connected [[multimedia framework]] supports. It is the default video player in the [[KDE 4]] version of [[Kubuntu]] 8.04.<ref>[http://kubuntu.org/announcements/8.04-release.php Kubuntu 8.04 Released]</ref>
